name: Jacobus Henricus van 't Hoff
rationale: [for his] discovery of the laws of chemical dynamics and osmotic pressure in solutions

name: Hermann Emil Fischer
rationale: [for] his work on sugar and purine syntheses

name: Svante August Arrhenius
rationale: [for] his electrolytic theory of dissociation

name: Sir William Ramsay
rationale: [for his] discovery of the inert gaseous elements in air, and his determination of their place in the periodic system

name: Johann Friedrich Wilhelm Adolf von Baeyer
rationale: [for] the advancement of organic chemistry and the chemical industry, through his work on organic dyes and hydroaromatic compounds

name: Henri Moissan
rationale: [for his] investigation and isolation of the element fluorine, and for [the] electric furnace called after him

name: Eduard Buchner
rationale: for his biochemical researches and his discovery of cell-free fermentation

name: Ernest Rutherford
rationale: for his investigations into the disintegration of the elements, and the chemistry of radioactive substances

name: Wilhelm Ostwald
rationale: [for] his work on catalysis and for his investigations into the fundamental principles governing chemical equilibria and rates of reaction

name: Otto Wallach
rationale: [for] his services to organic chemistry and the chemical industry by his pioneer work in the field of alicyclic compounds

name: Maria Skłodowska-Curie
rationale: [for] the discovery of the elements radium and polonium, by the isolation of radium and the study of the nature and compounds of this remarkable element

name: Victor Grignard
rationale: for the discovery of the [...] Grignard reagent

name: Paul Sabatier
rationale: for the discovery of the [...] Grignard reagent

name: Alfred Werner
rationale: [for] his work on the linkage of atoms in molecules [...] especially in inorganic chemistry

name: Theodore William Richards
rationale: [for] his accurate determinations of the atomic weight of a large number of chemical elements

name: Richard Martin Willstätter
rationale: for his researches on plant pigments, especially chlorophyll

name: Fritz Haber
rationale: for the synthesis of ammonia from its elements

name: Walther Hermann Nernst
rationale: [for] his work in thermochemistry

name: Frederick Soddy
rationale: for his contributions to our knowledge of the chemistry of radioactive substances, and his investigations into the origin and nature of isotopes

name: Francis William Aston
rationale: for his discovery, by means of his mass spectrograph, of isotopes, in a large number of non-radioactive elements, and for his enunciation of the whole-number rule

name: Fritz Pregl

name: Richard Adolf Zsigmondy
rationale: for his demonstration of the heterogeneous nature of colloid solutions and for the methods he used

rationale: for his work on disperse systems

name: Heinrich Otto Wieland
rationale: for his investigations of the constitution of the bile acids and related substances

name: Adolf Otto Reinhold Windaus
rationale: [for] his research into the constitution of the sterols and their connection with the vitamins

name: Hans Fischer
rationale: for his researches into the constitution of haemin and chlorophyll and especially for his synthesis of haemin

rationale: [for] their contributions to the invention and development of chemical high pressure methods

name: Friedrich Bergius
rationale: [for] their contributions to the invention and development of chemical high pressure methods

name: Irving Langmuir

name: Harold Clayton Urey
rationale: for his discovery of heavy hydrogen

name: Irène Joliot-Curie
rationale: [for] their synthesis of new radioactive elements

name: Sully Prudhomme
rationale: in special recognition of his poetic composition, which gives evidence of lofty idealism, artistic perfection and a rare combination of the qualities of both heart and intellect

name: Theodor Mommsen
rationale: the greatest living master of the art of historical writing, with special reference to his monumental work, A History of Rome

name: Bjørnstjerne Bjørnson
rationale: as a tribute to his noble, magnificent and versatile poetry, which has always been distinguished by both the freshness of its inspiration and the rare purity of its spirit

name: Frédéric Mistral
rationale: in recognition of the fresh originality and true inspiration of his poetic production, which faithfully reflects the natural scenery and native spirit of his people, and, in addition, his significant work as a Provençal philologist

name: Henryk Sienkiewicz
rationale: because of his outstanding merits as an epic writer

name: Giosuè Carducci
rationale: not only in consideration of his deep learning and critical research, but above all as a tribute to the creative energy, freshness of style, and lyrical force which characterize his poetic masterpieces

name: Rudyard Kipling
rationale: in consideration of the power of observation, originality of imagination, virility of ideas and remarkable talent for narration which characterize the creations of this world-famous author

name: Rudolf Christoph Eucken
rationale: in recognition of his earnest search for truth, his penetrating power of thought, his wide range of vision, and the warmth and strength in presentation with which in his numerous works he has vindicated and developed an idealistic philosophy of life

name: Selma Lagerlöf
rationale: in appreciation of the lofty idealism, vivid imagination and spiritual perception that characterize her writings

name: Paul von Heyse
rationale: as a tribute to the consummate artistry, permeated with idealism, which he has demonstrated during his long productive career as a lyric poet, dramatist, novelist and writer of world-renowned short stories

name: Maurice Maeterlinck
rationale: in appreciation of his many-sided literary activities, and especially of his dramatic works, which are distinguished by a wealth of imagination and by a poetic fancy, which reveals, sometimes in the guise of a fairy tale, a deep inspiration, while in a mysterious way they appeal to the readers' own feelings and stimulate their imaginations

name: Gerhart Hauptmann
rationale: primarily in recognition of his fruitful, varied and outstanding production in the realm of dramatic art

name: Rabindranath Tagore
rationale: because of his profoundly sensitive, fresh and beautiful verse, by which, with consummate skill, he has made his poetic thought, expressed in his own English words, a part of the literature of the West

name: Romain Rolland
rationale: as a tribute to the lofty idealism of his literary production and to the sympathy and love of truth with which he has described different types of human beings

name: Verner von Heidenstam
rationale: in recognition of his significance as the leading representative of a new era in our literature

name: Karl Adolph Gjellerup
rationale: for his varied and rich poetry, which is inspired by lofty ideals

name: Carl Spitteler
rationale: in special appreciation of his epic, Olympian Spring

name: Knut Hamsun
rationale: for his monumental work, Growth of the Soil

name: Anatole France
rationale: in recognition of his brilliant literary achievements, characterized as they are by a nobility of style, a profound human sympathy, grace, and a true Gallic temperament

name: Jacinto Benavente
rationale: for the happy manner in which he has continued the illustrious traditions of the Spanish drama

name: William Butler Yeats
rationale: for his always inspired poetry, which in a highly artistic form gives expression to the spirit of a whole nation

name: Władysław Reymont
rationale: for his great national epic, The Peasants

name: George Bernard Shaw
rationale: for his work which is marked by both idealism and humanity, its stimulating satire often being infused with a singular poetic beauty

name: Grazia Deledda
rationale: for her idealistically inspired writings which with plastic clarity picture the life on her native island and with depth and sympathy deal with human problems in general

name: Henri Bergson
rationale: in recognition of his rich and vitalizing ideas and the brilliant skill with which they have been presented

name: Sigrid Undset
rationale: principally for her powerful descriptions of Northern life during the Middle Ages

name: Thomas Mann
rationale: principally for his great novel, Buddenbrooks, which has won steadily increased recognition as one of the classic works of contemporary literature

name: Sinclair Lewis
rationale: for his vigorous and graphic art of description and his ability to create, with wit and humour, new types of characters

name: Erik Axel Karlfeldt
rationale: The poetry of Erik Axel Karlfeldt

name: John Galsworthy
rationale: for his distinguished art of narration which takes its highest form in The Forsyte Saga

name: Ivan Bunin
rationale: for the strict artistry with which he has carried on the classical Russian traditions in prose writing

name: Luigi Pirandello
rationale: for his bold and ingenious revival of dramatic and scenic art

name: Eugene O'Neill
rationale: for the power, honesty and deep-felt emotions of his dramatic works, which embody an original concept of tragedy

name: Roger Martin du Gard
rationale: for the artistic power and truth with which he has depicted human conflict as well as some fundamental aspects of contemporary life in his novel cycle Les Thibault

name: Pearl S. Buck
rationale: for her rich and truly epic descriptions of peasant life in China and for her biographical masterpieces

name: Frans Eemil Sillanpää

name: Johannes Vilhelm Jensen
rationale: for the rare strength and fertility of his poetic imagination with which is combined an intellectual curiosity of wide scope and a bold, freshly creative style

name: Gabriela Mistral
rationale: for her lyric poetry which, inspired by powerful emotions, has made her name a symbol of the idealistic aspirations of the entire Latin American world

name: Hermann Hesse
rationale: for his inspired writings which, while growing in boldness and penetration, exemplify the classical humanitarian ideals and high qualities of style

name: André Gide
rationale: for his comprehensive and artistically significant writings, in which human problems and conditions have been presented with a fearless love of truth and keen psychological insight

name: T. S. Eliot

United Kingdom
(Born in the  United States)
rationale: for his outstanding, pioneer contribution to present-day poetry

name: William Faulkner
rationale: for his powerful and artistically unique contribution to the modern American novel

name: The Earl Russell
rationale: in recognition of his varied and significant writings in which he champions humanitarian ideals and freedom of thought

name: Pär Lagerkvist
rationale: for the artistic vigour and true independence of mind with which he endeavours in his poetry to find answers to the eternal questions confronting mankind

name: François Mauriac
rationale: for the deep spiritual insight and the artistic intensity with which he has in his novels penetrated the drama of human life

name: Sir Winston Churchill
rationale: for his mastery of historical and biographical description as well as for brilliant oratory in defending exalted human values

name: Ernest Hemingway
rationale: for his mastery of the art of narrative, most recently demonstrated in The Old Man and the Sea, and for the influence that he has exerted on contemporary style

name: Halldór Laxness

name: Juan Ramón Jiménez
rationale: for his lyrical poetry, which in Spanish language constitutes an example of high spirit and artistical purity

name: Albert Camus
rationale: for his important literary production, which with clear-sighted earnestness illuminates the problems of the human conscience in our times

name: Boris Pasternak
rationale: for his important achievement both in contemporary lyrical poetry and in the field of the great Russian epic tradition

name: Salvatore Quasimodo
rationale: for his lyrical poetry, which with classical fire expresses the tragic experience of life in our own times

name: Saint-John Perse
rationale: for the soaring flight and the evocative imagery of his poetry which in a visionary fashion reflects the conditions of our time

name: Ivo Andrić
rationale: for the epic force with which he has traced themes and depicted human destinies drawn from the history of his country

name: John Steinbeck
rationale: for his realistic and imaginative writings, combining as they do sympathetic humour and keen social perception

name: Giorgos Seferis

name: Jean-Paul Sartre
rationale: for his work which, rich in ideas and filled with the spirit of freedom and the quest for truth, has exerted a far-reaching influence on our age

name: Mikhail Sholokhov

name: Shmuel Yosef Agnon

name: Miguel Ángel Asturias
rationale: for his vivid literary achievement, deep-rooted in the national traits and traditions of Indian peoples of Latin America

name: Yasunari Kawabata
rationale: for his narrative mastery, which with great sensibility expresses the essence of the Japanese mind

name: Samuel Beckett

name: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn
rationale: for the ethical force with which he has pursued the indispensable traditions of Russian literature

name: Pablo Neruda
rationale: for a poetry that with the action of an elemental force brings alive a continent's destiny and dreams

name: Heinrich Böll

name: Patrick White

name: Eyvind Johnson
rationale: for a narrative art, farseeing in lands and ages, in the service of freedom

name: Eugenio Montale

name: Saul Bellow
rationale: for the human understanding and subtle analysis of contemporary culture that are combined in his work

name: Vicente Aleixandre

name: Isaac Bashevis Singer

name: Odysseas Elytis

name: Czesław Miłosz

name: Elias Canetti
rationale: for writings marked by a broad outlook, a wealth of ideas and artistic power

name: Gabriel García Márquez
rationale: for his novels and short stories, in which the fantastic and the realistic are combined in a richly composed world of imagination, reflecting a continent's life and conflicts

name: William Golding

name: Jaroslav Seifert

name: Octavio Paz
